markers.name: Renfrewshire Credit Union
markers.body: Renfrewshire Wide Credit Union was established in 2006 as a merger of 3 smaller credit unions in Erskine, Renfrew and Linwood which has served the local community for over 30 years.

markers.name: Bank of Scotland
markers.body: Bank of Scotland was founded in 1695, by an Act of the Scottish Parliament - making it Scotland"s first and oldest bank. It has enjoyed a long and prestigious history, acquiring many constituent companies along the way.
markers.address: The Cross, Gilmour St, Paisley PA1 1DD

markers.name: TSB Bank
markers.body: We provide local banking for Britain to help local people, businesses and communities to thrive together.

markers.name: Santander
markers.body: We are Santander Bank, one of the country"s top retail banks by deposits and a wholly owned subsidiary of one of the most respected banks in the world: Banco Santander. Our parent company, Santander Group, serves more than 100 million customers in the United Kingdom, Latin America, and Europe. Here in the Northeast, we are a team of 9,800 individuals all committed to a single mission: to help you make progress toward your goals. We aim to make your banking hassle-free by providing simple ways for you to spend, save and manage your money.

markers.name: Financial Advisor
markers.body: Financial Advisor Bureau is the free service that connects you with an Independent Financial Advisor (IFA) in your area for a free consultation. All IFA"s on our panel are registered and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, the regulatory for the financial services industry in the UK.

markers.name: Financial Planning Options
markers.body: As professional Independent Financial Advisers, Financial Planning Options Limited are authorised to deal with many forms of financial services, and specialise in giving advice to clients on a wide range of subjects to assist with personal and corporate financial planning. We listen to your needs, and offer clear, no-jargon advice on the most appropriate financial products for your personal circumstances.
markers.address: Suite 49, Abbey Mill Business Centre, PA1 1TJ

markers.name: Royal Bank of Scotland
markers.body: At RBS, our purpose is to serve customers well. We serve around 24 million customers across the globe, and our aim is to consistently meet their needs wherever they find us.

markers.name: Advance Financial Strategies
markers.body: Our service is grounded in the highest professional standards, we acknowledge that all our clients are unique individuals and, as such, deserve bespoke financial solutions tailored to their own financial needs.

markers.name: Renfrewshire Council
markers.body: Always check the local council who can always pass you advice on what to do.

markers.name: Barnardos Threads
markers.body: Barnardo’s Threads supports parents, carers and families in the community and in diverse cultural circumstances. Guidance and advice aimed at supporting vulnerable children and their families.

markers.name: Home Start
markers.body: Home-Start Renfrewshire and Inverclyde is a local independent charity which has been set up to give friendship, advice and practical support to families who live in the Renfrewshire and Inverclyde areas and who have at least one child under the age of 5.

markers.name: Citizen Advice
markers.body: Provides local advice tailored to your situation

markers.name: Anderson Barr Consultants
markers.body: For the very best in mortgages, financial advice and pension advice, call Anderson Barr Consultants.

markers.name: White Cart Credit Union
markers.body: The White Cart Credit Union is a member of The Association of British Credit Unions Ltd (ABCUL), the leading trade association for credit unions in England, Scotland and Wales.

markers.name: Gennifer Credit Union
markers.body: At Gleniffer Credit Union, We Believe in people helping people, ethical business practices, supporting the community, listening to members’ needs, delivering an excellent service, financial services being affordable and accessible, making financial decisions in the interests of the members.

markers.name: Nationwide
markers.body: Whether it’s with the products and services we provide, the charities and causes we support or the communities we serve, everything we do is with our members’ best interests at heart.

markers.name: Clydesdale Bank
markers.body: With roots back to its establishment in Glasgow in 1838. Clydesdale Bank has a proud history of innovation and support for Scottish industry and communities.

markers.name: TSB Bank
markers.body: We provide local banking for Britain to help local people, businesses and communities to thrive together.

markers.name: Clydesdale Bank
markers.body: With roots back to its establishment in Glasgow in 1838. Clydesdale Bank has a proud history of innovation and support for Scottish industry and communities.

markers.name: Families First Ferguslie
markers.body: We bring a range of existing council, health and voluntary services together under the Families First banner to make them easier to find and easier to use.

markers.name: Families First Gallowhill
markers.body: We bring a range of existing council, health and voluntary services together under the Families First banner to make them easier to find and easier to use.

markers.name: Families First Linwood
markers.body: We bring a range of existing council, health and voluntary services together under the Families First banner to make them easier to find and easier to use.

markers.name: Families First Johnstone
markers.body: We bring a range of existing council, health and voluntary services together under the Families First banner to make them easier to find and easier to use.

markers.name: Families First Foxbar
markers.body: We bring a range of existing council, health and voluntary services together under the Families First banner to make them easier to find and easier to use.

markers.name: Renfrewshire Carers Centre
markers.body: Renfrewshire Carers Centre offers a variety of different services to support you in your caring role. If you are interested in contacting us about any of our services it's easy - you can use the contact us section of this website or email enquiries@renfrewshirecarers.org.uk or telephone 0141 887 3643.  We also offer a drop in service for carers, please see here for our opening hours.
markers.address: Unit 55/Embroidery mill/ Abbey mill business centre, Paisley, PA1 1JT

markers.name: Citizens Advice Bureau
markers.body: Citizens Advice Scotland, our 61 member bureaux and our consumer helpline together form Scotland’s largest independent advice network. We help more than 300,000 people solve their problems each year in communities everywhere from city centres to the Highlands and Islands. And we look at the problems people bring to our advice services and campaign for change where it’s needed most. We work for a fairer Scotland where people are empowered and their rights respected.

markers.name: Christians against poverty
markers.body: We exist because nobody should be held hostage by debt and poverty. But the truth is that they are rife in the UK. In a society where people live behind closed doors, thousands are desperately poor. Unable to feed their children, incapable of paying to heat their homes in winter, the grip of poverty is relentless. It breaks families apart and drives many to think that suicide is the only solution. We are passionate about releasing people in our nation from a life sentence of debt, poverty and their causes. Through our services, which are all run through local churches, we are tackling poverty head on. Our vision is to bring freedom and good news to people in every community through 1,000 CAP projects by 2021.

markers.name: Linstone Housing Association
markers.body: Linstone Housing Association was set up in 1998 following a stock transfer from Scottish Homes. With around 1570 properties, we are one of the largest housing associations in Renfrewshire and most of our houses are in Linwood and Johnstone – hence the name.

markers.name: Bridgewater Housing Association
markers.body: The Core Housing Services that Bridgewater delivers are summarised as follows: Housing Management Services, including Estate Management, Lettings and Resident Involvement, Tenant Participation and Rent Arrears Management. Property Management including Planned and Responsive Repairs and Factoring. Development of Social Housing including purpose built complexes for people with particular needs.
markers.address: 1st floor, Bridgewater shopping centre, Erskine, PA8 7AA

markers.name: Key Housing Association
markers.body: KEY provides purpose-built housing in 15 local authority areas as follows: Argyll & Bute, Clackmannanshire, Dumfries&Galloway, East Ayrshire, East Dunbartonshire, Falkirk, Glasgow, Highland, Inverclyde, North Ayrshire, North Lanarkshire, Renfrewshire, South Lanarkshire, Stirling, West Dunbartonshire. If you would like further details of where our housing is located then please get in touch with our housing department at our main Glasgow office.

markers.name: Loretto Care Housing Association
markers.body: Welcome to the website of Loretto Housing Association. Loretto Housing Association works closely with our public sector funding partners - the Scottish Government and Local Authorities - to provide housing, care and support to those in greatest need. We have more than 1200 affordable homes in the central belt. Through our subsidiary company Loretto Care we also provide care and support services to around 1800 people.

markers.name: Paisley South Housing Association
markers.body: We are a not-for-profit organisation, formed by local people concerned at the lack of affordable housing in our communities. We have been a Registered Social Landlord since 1984 and a Scottish Charity from 2004. We are an independent body, accountable to our membership. A copy of the Rules of the Association can be downloaded from related documents at the bottom of the page.
